GNU Make also has compatible versions running on various flavors of Windows and Mac OS X. It is also a very stable version with historical significance that remains popular. It is for these reasons that GNU Make is often taught alongside C and C++."

          "version": 1

      },
      "8c496ae9-a193-43e2-a86d-3cb7986a73c7": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1550523809631,
          "id": "8c496ae9-a193-43e2-a86d-3cb7986a73c7",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1550523809631,
          "parent_id": "21c5f5bf-830f-4d93-a209-0ebc3ccf1c67",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "CXX=g++\nCXXFLAGS=-Wall -Wextra -pedantic\nEXE=app\n\nSRCS_GLOB=src/*.cpp\nSRCS=$(wildcard $(SRCS_GLOB))\nOBJS=$(SRCS:.cpp=.o)\n\nall: $(EXE)\n\n$(EXE): $(OBJS)\n    @$(CXX) -o $@ $(OBJS)\n\ndepend: .depend\n\n.depend: $(SRCS)\n    @-rm -f ./.depend\n    @$(CXX) $(CXXFLAGS) -MM $^>>./.depend\n\nclean:\n    -rm -f $(EXE)\n    -rm $(OBJS)\n    -rm *~\n    -rm .depend\n\ninclude .depend"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "a848fee2-d85d-45b5-8c7d-b5f3379374e5": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1550523809629,
          "id": "a848fee2-d85d-45b5-8c7d-b5f3379374e5",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1550523809629,
          "parent_id": "21c5f5bf-830f-4d93-a209-0ebc3ccf1c67",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "# Set some variables to use in our command\n# First, we set the compiler to be g++\nCXX=g++\n\n# Then, we say that we want to compile with g++'s recommended warnings and some extra ones.\nCXXFLAGS=-Wall -Wextra -pedantic\n\n# This will be the output file\nEXE=app\n\nSRCS=main.cpp\n\n# When you call `make` at the command line, this \"target\" is called.\n# The $(EXE) at the right says that the `all` target depends on the `$(EXE)` target.\n# $(EXE) expands to be the content of the EXE variable\n# Note: Because this is the first target, it becomes the default target if `make` is called without target\nall: $(EXE)\n\n# This is equivalent to saying\n# app: $(SRCS)\n# $(SRCS) can be separated, which means that this target would depend on each file.\n# Note that this target has a \"method body\": the part indented by a tab (not four spaces).\n# When we build this target, make will execute the command, which is:\n# g++ -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -o app main.cpp\n# I.E. Compile main.cpp with warnings, and output to the file ./app\n$(EXE): $(SRCS)\n    @$(CXX) $(CXXFLAGS) -o $@ $(SRCS)\n\n# This target should reverse the `all` target. If you call\n# make with an argument, like `make clean`, the corresponding target\n# gets called.\nclean:\n    @rm -f $(EXE)"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }
      },

        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1550523809633,
          "id": "c0ccec06-2d92-4ef3-98fa-eda9f75c7a51",

            "title": [
              ["The GNU Make (styled "],
              ["make", [["c"]]],
              [
                ") is a program dedicated to the automation of executing shell commands. GNU Make is one specific program that falls under the Make family. Make remains popular among Unix-like and POSIX-like operating systems, including those derived from the Linux kernel, Mac OS X, and BSD."
              ]
